heading: guilty
subheading: a texas jury took less than three hours tuesday to return a guilty verdict against john william king, one of three white men charged with killing a black man by chaining him to a pickup truck and dragging him to his death. king, who could receive the death penalty, was convicted by a jury of 11 whites and 1 black of murdering james byrd jr. last june. the same jury will now decide whether to sentence king to death or to life imprisonment. two other defendants, lawrence brewer and shawn berry, will be tried for murder later this year.
author: wired staff
